Persecution1 has rolled upon our heads from time to time, from portions of the United States, like peals of thunder, because of our religion; and no portion of the Government as yet has stepped forward for our relief.2 And in view of these things, I feel it to be my right and privilege to obtain what influence3 and power I can, lawfully, in the United States, for the protection of injured innocence; and if I lose my life in a good cause4 I am willing to be sacrificed on the altar of virtue,5 righteousness and truth, in maintaining the laws6 and Constitution of the United States,7 if need be, for the general good of mankind. (Feb. 8, 1844.) DHC 6:210-211.

Western Movement for the Church Contemplated

I instructed the Twelve Apostles to send out a delegation and investigate the locations of California and Oregon, and hunt out a good location, where we can remove to after the temple is completed, and where we can build a city in a day,8 and have a government of our own, get up into the mountains,9 where the devil cannot dig us out, and live in a healthful climate, where we can live as old as we have a mind to. (Feb. 20, 1844.) DHC 6:222.

To Gain Salvation the Laws of God Must Be Obeyed

I * * * spoke to the people, showing them that to get salvation we must not only do some things, but everything which God has commanded.10 Men may preach and practice everything except those things which God commands us to do, and will be damned at last.11 We may tithe mint and rue,12 and all manner of herbs,13 and still not obey the commandments of God.14 The object with me is to obey and teach others to obey God15 in just what He tells us to do. It mattereth not whether the principle is popular or unpopular, I will always maintain a true principle, even if I stand alone in it. (Feb. 21, 1844.) DHC 6:223.
